info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 13 at 3:09PM EST by NWS Albany
info.description: ...SCATTERED MODERATE TO HEAVY SNOW SHOWERS WILL AFFECT PARTS OF SOUTHERN FULTON...HAMILTON... NORTHERN FULTON...SOUTHERN HERKIMER...SOUTHERN SARATOGA...AND NORTHERN SARATOGA COUNTIES... HAZARDS...Snow showers accompanied by winds of up to 30 MPH which can rapidly reduce visibility to less than one half mile. LOCATION AND MOVEMENT...At 307 PM EST, snow showers were 8 miles north of Caroga Lake, or 16 miles northwest of Gloversville moving east at 40 MPH. THE SNOW SHOWERS WILL BE NEAR... Cranberry Creek around 325 PM EST. Northville and Northampton Beach Public Campground around 330 PM EST. SAFETY INFO... Use extra caution if you must travel into or through this squall. Rapid changes in visibility and potentially slick roads may lead to accidents. &&
